theotokion.tone_1.resurrectional.content: O holy tabernacle, when Gabriel cried out to you:* Rejoice O Virgin, full of grace,* the Lord of all became incarnate of you,* as the righteous David had foretold.* In bearing your Creator, you have shown yourself to surpass the vastness of the heavens.* We, therefore, cry out: Glory to Him Who dwelt in you!* Glory to Him Who came forth from you!* Glory to Him Who has set us free through your life-giving birth!
theotokion.tone_1.resurrectional.usage: Resurrectional – Saturday Vespers and Sunday Matins, and for a Polyeleos

theotokion.tone_1.sunday_vespers.content: The universe recognizes in you, O Woman Full of Grace,* the marvel of marvels, and it rejoices.* You have borne without human seed* the One Whom even the highest ranks of angels cannot look upon,* and you have given Him birth in a manner beyond understanding.* Intercede with Him for the salvation of our souls.
theotokion.tone_1.sunday_vespers.usage: Sunday Vespers and Monday Matins after God the Lord...

theotokion.tone_1.monday_matins_end.content: Rejoice, O pure Mother of God,* blessed in heaven and glorified on earth!* Rejoice, O bride and Virgin forever!
theotokion.tone_1.monday_matins_end.usage: Monday at the end of Matins

theotokion.tone_1.mon_wed_vespers.content: You have borne the fire of the Godhead without being burned;* you have given birth to the Lord, the Source life,* O Mother of God and woman full of grace,* save all those who exalt you.
theotokion.tone_1.mon_wed_vespers.usage: Monday and Wednesday Vespers; and Tuesday and Thursday Matins after God the Lord...

theotokion.tone_1.tue_thu_matins_end.content: Without the assistance of a father on earth,* you have given birth in a manner beyond understanding* to the One Who was born without a mother in heaven.* O Mother of God, intercede with Him for our souls!
theotokion.tone_1.tue_thu_matins_end.usage: Tuesday and Thursday at the end of Matins

theotokion.tone_1.tue_thu_vespers.content: O pure One, we have obtained your protection.* Through your intercession, we have been kept from harm* and surrounded at all times with the grace of your Son’s cross.* Therefore, we exalt you with great devotion.
theotokion.tone_1.tue_thu_vespers.usage: Tuesday and Thursday Vespers; Wednesday and Friday Matins after God the Lord...

theotokion.tone_1.wed_fri_matins_end.content: Rejoice, O pure Mother of God... (see above).
theotokion.tone_1.wed_fri_matins_end.usage: Wednesday and Friday at the end of Matins

theotokion.tone_1.fri_vespers.usage: Friday Vespers and Saturday Matins after God the Lord...

theotokion.tone_1.sat_matins_end.content: Without the assistance of a father... (see above).
theotokion.tone_1.sat_matins_end.usage: Saturday at the end of Matins

theotokion.tone_2.resurrectional.content: O Mother of God, the mysteries which surround you are exceedingly glorious* and beyond the power of understanding.* For you retained the seal of purity,* and your virginity remained inviolate;* yet you are acknowledged, without doubt,* to be the Mother who gave birth to the true God.* We beg you, therefore, to entreat Him to save our souls.
theotokion.tone_2.resurrectional.usage: Resurrectional – Saturday Vespers and Sunday Matins, and for a Polyeleos

theotokion.tone_2.sunday_vespers.content: O Mother of God, you are a fountain of mercy;* count us worthy of your compassion;* look upon a people who have sinned;* manifest your power as you always do.* Because of our trust in you, we cry out to you* as once did Gabriel, the commander of the angels.
theotokion.tone_2.sunday_vespers.usage: Sunday Vespers and Monday Matins after God the Lord...

theotokion.tone_2.monday_matins_end.content: O holy Mother, Mother of the inexpressible Light, we honor you with angelic hymns, and we all exalt you with great devotion.
theotokion.tone_2.monday_matins_end.usage: Monday at the end of Matins

theotokion.tone_2.mon_wed_vespers.content: O Mother of God and virgin forever,* through you we have been made to share the divine nature;* you have given birth for us to the incarnate God.* Therefore, we all exalt you with great devotion.
theotokion.tone_2.mon_wed_vespers.usage: Monday and Wednesday Vespers; Tuesday and Thursday Matins after God the Lord...

theotokion.tone_2.tue_thu_matins_end.content: O Mother of God, we glorify you and cry out:* Rejoice, O cloud of the never-fading Light!* You have borne in your womb the very Lord of glory!
theotokion.tone_2.tue_thu_matins_end.usage: Tuesday and Thursday at the end of Matins

theotokion.tone_2.tue_thu_vespers.content: O Virgin and all-glorious Mother of God,* we sing to you a hymn of praise,* for Hades has been destroyed by your Son’s cross;* Death has been put to death,* and we, the dead, have been made to rise and become worthy of life.* We have obtained paradise, the original bliss.* Therefore, we glorify you by giving thanks to Christ our God,* for He alone is almighty and all-merciful.
theotokion.tone_2.tue_thu_vespers.usage: Tuesday and Thursday Vespers; Wednesday and Friday Matins after God the Lord...

theotokion.tone_2.wed_fri_matins_end.content: O Mother of God, we glorify you and cry out:* Rejoice, O branch who budded forth God without human seed!* He has crushed Death on the cross.
theotokion.tone_2.wed_fri_matins_end.usage: Wednesday and Friday at the end of Matins

theotokion.tone_2.fri_vespers.content: O Mother of God, the mysteries..., (see above).
theotokion.tone_2.fri_vespers.usage: Friday Vespers and Saturday Matins after God the Lord...

theotokion.tone_2.sat_matins_end.content: O holy Mother, Mother of the inexpressible Light... (see above).
theotokion.tone_2.sat_matins_end.usage: Saturday at the end of Matins

theotokion.tone_3.resurrectional.content: We sing your praises, O Virgin,* for; as the Mother of God, you always intercede for the salvation of the human race.* It is from you that our God and your Son took flesh.* Then, by suffering the passion on the cross,* and out of love for mankind, He delivered us from corruption.
theotokion.tone_3.resurrectional.usage: Resurrectional – Saturday Vespers and Sunday Matins, and for a Polyeleos

theotokion.tone_3.sunday_vespers.content: Gabriel was rapt in amazement as he beheld your virginity* and the splendor of your purity, O Mother of God,* and he cried out to You:* By what name shall I call you? I am bewildered, I am lost.* I shall greet you as I was commanded to do:* Rejoice, O Woman Full of Grace!
theotokion.tone_3.sunday_vespers.usage: Sunday Vespers and Monday Matins after God the Lord...

theotokion.tone_3.monday_matins_end.content: Indeed, everyone runs to the place of salvation.* O Mother of God, what other shelter can protect our souls as well as you?
theotokion.tone_3.monday_matins_end.usage: Monday at the end of Matins

theotokion.tone_3.generic.content: O Mother of God, powerful protectress of the world,* you are our shelter and you are our strength.* Through your intercession, protect your servants against all dangers,* for you are the only blessed One!
theotokion.tone_3.generic.usage: Monday Vespers and Tuesday Matins after God the Lord...

theotokion.tone_3.generic_alt.usage: Thursday at the end of Matins

theotokion.tone_3.tue_thu_vespers.content: O Mother of God, we have obtained your Son’s cross as a staff of power* with which to strike down the boastings of the enemy.* Therefore, we exalt you without ceasing.
theotokion.tone_3.tue_thu_vespers.usage: Tuesday and Thursday Vespers; Wednesday and Friday Matins after God the Lord...

theotokion.tone_3.wed_fri_matins_end.content: O Mother of God, powerful protectress... (see above).
theotokion.tone_3.wed_fri_matins_end.usage: Wednesday and Friday at the end of Matins

theotokion.tone_3.fri_vespers.usage: Friday Vespers and Saturday Matins after God the Lord...

theotokion.tone_3.sat_matins_end.usage: Saturday at the end of Matins

theotokion.tone_4.resurrectional.content: O Mother of God, the mystery hidden from all eternity* and unknown even to the angels,* was revealed through you to those on earth:* God took on our human nature* and united it to His divine nature in a perfect but unconfused union.* Then, He willingly accepted the cross for our sake* and thereby raised again the first created,* and saved our souls from death.
theotokion.tone_4.resurrectional.usage: Resurrectional – Saturday Vespers and Sunday Matins, and for a Polyeleos

theotokion.tone_4.sunday_vespers.content: To the One who was reared in the Temple,* close to the Holy of Holies,* and who was full of faith, wisdom, and perfect virginity,* Gabriel, the captain and leader,* offered esteem and greetings from heaven when he said:* Rejoice, O blessed One! Rejoice, O glorified One!* The Lord is with you.
theotokion.tone_4.sunday_vespers.usage: Sunday Vespers and Monday Matins after God the Lord...

theotokion.tone_4.monday_matins_end.content: Since you are placed above all creatures, O Mother of God,* we cannot sing a hymn of praise that is worthy of you.* Therefore, we ask you as a gracious favor:* Have mercy on us!
theotokion.tone_4.monday_matins_end.usage: Monday at the end of Matins

theotokion.tone_4.generic.content: Let us poor sinners hasten with fervor to the Mother of God;* let us humbly kneel before her and say from the depth of our hearts:* O Lady, be kind to us and help us.* Hasten, for we are perishing under a multitude of sins.* Do not turn away your servants empty-handed,* for you are their only hope and protection.
theotokion.tone_4.generic.usage: Monday Vespers and Tuesday Matins after God the Lord...

theotokion.tone_4.generic_alt.content: Since you are placed above all creatures... (see above).
theotokion.tone_4.generic_alt.usage: Thursday at the end of Matins

theotokion.tone_4.tue_thu_vespers.content: O Virgin, all immaculate Mother of Christ God,* a sword pierced your all-holy soul* when you saw your Son and God willingly crucified.* Therefore, O blessed One,* never cease to pray to Him* that He may grant us forgiveness of our sins.
theotokion.tone_4.tue_thu_vespers.usage: Tuesday and Thursday Vespers; Wednesday and Friday Matins after God the Lord...

theotokion.tone_4.wed_fri_matins_end.content: We exalt you, O Mother of God, crying out:* You are the mountain out of whom, in a wondrous way,* a stone was hewn that crushed the gates of Hades.
theotokion.tone_4.wed_fri_matins_end.usage: Wednesday and Friday at the end of Matins

theotokion.tone_4.fri_vespers.content: O Mother of God, the mystery... (see above).
theotokion.tone_4.fri_vespers.usage: Friday Vespers and Saturday Matins after God the Lord...

theotokion.tone_4.sat_matins_end.content: We exalt you, O Mother of God... (see above).
theotokion.tone_4.sat_matins_end.usage: Saturday at the end of Matins

theotokion.tone_5.resurrectional.content: Rejoice, Virgin, impassable gateway of the Lord!* Rejoice, protective wall of those who take refuge in you!* Rejoice, peaceful haven untroubled by storms!* Rejoice, O Virgin who has not known wedlock* and yet has given birth in the flesh to your Creator and God!* O Mother of God, never cease to intercede* for those who praise and worship your Son.
theotokion.tone_5.resurrectional.usage: Resurrectional – Saturday Vespers, Sunday Matins, and for a Polyeleos

theotokion.tone_5.sunday_vespers.content:
With the angels of heaven and with those upon earth,* O Mother of God, we cry out to you exultingly:* Rejoice, O gate that is wider than heaven!* Rejoice, only salvation of the human race!* Rejoice, O honorable One, full of grace,* who gave birth to the incarnate God!

Monday at the end of Matins

O Christ God, You revealed yourself to the world through a Virgin,* and through her made us to be children of light,* have mercy upon all of us.
theotokion.tone_5.sunday_vespers.usage: Sunday Vespers and Monday Matins after God the Lord...

theotokion.tone_5.generic.content: O Mother of God, show forth to your servants* your ready protection, your help, and your mercy;* in your purity, calm the storms of my vain thoughts* and lift up my poor soul;* for I know, O Virgin, that you can do whatever you will.
theotokion.tone_5.generic.usage: Monday Vespers and Tuesday Matins after God the Lord...

theotokion.tone_5.generic_alt.usage: Thursday at the end of Matins

theotokion.tone_5.tue_thu_vespers.content: Since you are all-pleasing to God,* may the error of idol worship be destroyed,* and may the power of demons be trodden underfoot* by the might of your Son’s cross.* Therefore, we the faithful always sing to you in humility;* we bless you and we exalt you, professing that you are truly the Mother of God.
theotokion.tone_5.tue_thu_vespers.usage: Tuesday and Thursday Vespers; Wednesday and Friday Matins after God the Lord...

theotokion.tone_5.wed_fri_matins_end.usage: Wednesday and Friday at the end of Matins

theotokion.tone_5.fri_vespers.content: Rejoice, O Virgin, Impassable gateway... (see above).
theotokion.tone_5.fri_vespers.usage: Friday Vespers and Saturday Matins after God the Lord...

theotokion.tone_5.sat_matins_end.usage: Saturday at the end of Matins

theotokion.tone_6.resurrectional.content: Christ, Who called you Mother and the Blessed One,* accepted the passion of His own free will.* In His desire to find the fallen Adam,* He caused light to shine from His cross in order to search him out.* Then He said to the angels:* Rejoice with Me, for I have found the lost piece of silver.* Glory to You, O God,* who accomplished all things in such wisdom!
theotokion.tone_6.resurrectional.usage: Resurrectional – Saturday Vespers, Sunday Matins, and for a Polyeleos

theotokion.tone_6.sunday_vespers.content: The announcement of Gabriel to the Virgin* was the beginning of salvation,* for she heard the salutation and did not flee from the greeting,* nor did she doubt as did Sarah in the tent.* She proclaimed instead: Behold the handmaid of the Lord.* Be it done to me according to your word.
theotokion.tone_6.sunday_vespers.usage: Sunday Vespers and Monday Matins after God the Lord...

theotokion.tone_6.monday_matins_end.content: O Mother of God, by accepting the word of the archangel,* you became a cherubic throne,* and received in your arms* the hope of our souls.
theotokion.tone_6.monday_matins_end.usage: Monday at the end of Matins

theotokion.tone_6.generic.content: O virgin Mother of God, good hope of the world,* we seek no other help than your power.* Have compassion for your people who have no other protector* and intercede with the merciful God* that He may save our souls from all dangers,* for you are the only blessed one.
theotokion.tone_6.generic.usage: Monday Vespers and Tuesday Matins after God the Lord...

theotokion.tone_6.generic_alt.content: You deserved great spiritual favors, O pure virgin Mother of God,* for you gave birth out of your flesh* to one of the persons of the Trinity, Christ the Life-giver,* for the salvation of our souls.
theotokion.tone_6.generic_alt.usage: Thursday at the end of Matins

theotokion.tone_6.tue_thu_vespers.content: O virgin Mother of God,* pray to your Son, Christ our God, Who delivered the world from error when He accepted willingly to be crucified, that He may have mercy on our souls.
theotokion.tone_6.tue_thu_vespers.usage: Tuesday and Thursday Vespers; Wednesday and Friday Matins after God the Lord...

theotokion.tone_6.wed_fri_matins_end.content: You bore God the Son and the Word of God;* He was born of the Father without a mother before all ages,* and was incarnate in time of your pure blood without a man.* Intercede with Him that He may grant us* the forgiveness of our sins before the end.
theotokion.tone_6.wed_fri_matins_end.usage: Wednesday and Friday at the end of Matins

theotokion.tone_6.fri_vespers.content: Christ, Who called you Mother... (see above).
theotokion.tone_6.fri_vespers.usage: Friday Vespers and Saturday Matins after God the Lord...

theotokion.tone_6.sat_matins_end.content: You bore God the Son... (see above).
theotokion.tone_6.sat_matins_end.usage: Saturday at the end of Matins

theotokion.tone_7.resurrectional.content: O Mother of God, we sing your praises,* for you were a Virgin before conceiving* and remained a virgin after giving birth.* And since you have given birth to our Salvation, Jesus Christ,* you have become a treasury of assistance* for all who seek resurrection and eternal life.* Therefore, lift us up from the depth of our transgressions,* for we place our hope in you:
theotokion.tone_7.resurrectional.usage: Resurrectional – Saturday Vespers, Sunday Matins, and for a Polyeleos

theotokion.tone_7.sunday_vespers.content: O Mother of God, most pure Virgin,* with the heavenly Powers pray to your Son,* that, before our death, He grant forgiveness of sins* to us, who faithfully extol you.
theotokion.tone_7.sunday_vespers.usage: Sunday Vespers and Monday Matins after God the Lord...

theotokion.tone_7.monday_matins_end.content: O blessed Mother of God,* you appeared higher than the powers of heaven,* for you became a divine temple* by giving birth to Christ, the Savior of our souls.
theotokion.tone_7.monday_matins_end.usage: Monday at the end of Matins

theotokion.tone_7.generic.content: O Mother of God,* we honor you,* for you were seen to be higher than the angels* when you carried God in your womb.
theotokion.tone_7.generic.usage: Monday Vespers and Tuesday Matins after God the Lord...

theotokion.tone_7.generic_alt.content: O bride of God, the fruit of your womb* was seen as the cause of the salvation of all.* Therefore, we the faithful glorify you in our minds and through our words,* and we exalt you, O Mother of God!
theotokion.tone_7.generic_alt.usage: Thursday at the end of Matins

theotokion.tone_7.tue_thu_vespers.content: O virgin Mother of God,* unceasingly intercede with Christ our God* who was crucified for us and destroyed the power of Death,* that He may save our souls.
theotokion.tone_7.tue_thu_vespers.usage: Tuesday and Thursday Vespers; Wednesday and Friday Matins after God the Lord...

theotokion.tone_7.wed_fri_matins_end.content:
O Mother of God,* deliver us from our deep-rooted sins,* for we, the faithful, have no hope but in you* and in God Who was born of you.

Wednesday Vespers and Thursday Matins after God the Lord:...

O pure One, the fruit of your womb* is the perfect fulfillment of the prophets and of the Law.* Therefore, O Mother of God,* we glorify you with thanks and we exalt you with great devotion.
theotokion.tone_7.wed_fri_matins_end.usage: Wednesday and Friday at the end of Matins

theotokion.tone_7.fri_vespers.content: O Mother of God, we sing your praises... (see above).
theotokion.tone_7.fri_vespers.usage: Friday Vespers and Saturday Matins after God the Lord...

theotokion.tone_7.sat_matins_end.content: Rejoice, O woman who contained within your womb* the One Whom the heavens cannot hold!* Rejoice, O Virgin foretold by the prophets, from whom Immanuel arose!* Rejoice, O Mother of Christ our God!
theotokion.tone_7.sat_matins_end.usage: Saturday at the end of Matins

theotokion.tone_8.resurrectional.content: O gracious Lord, for the sake of all You were born of a virgin;* through Your death on the cross You conquered Death;* and through Your resurrection You revealed Yourself as God.* O merciful Lord, do not disdain those whom You have created with Your own hands,* but show forth Your love for us.* Accept the intercession which the Mother who bore You makes in our behalf.* O Savior, save Your despairing people!
theotokion.tone_8.resurrectional.usage: Resurrectional Saturday Vespers, Sunday Matins, and for a Polyeleos

theotokion.tone_8.sunday_vespers.content: Rejoice, O woman who at the angel’s greeting contained the Joy of the world!* Rejoice, for you gave birth to your Creator and Lord!* Rejoice, for you were made worthy to become the Mother of God.
theotokion.tone_8.sunday_vespers.usage: Sunday Vespers and Monday Matins after God the Lord...

theotokion.tone_8.monday_matins_end.content: Rejoice, O gate of the King of glory,* through which none but the Most High has passed,* and which was left sealed for the salvation of our souls!
theotokion.tone_8.monday_matins_end.usage: Monday at the end of Matins

theotokion.tone_8.generic.content: With hymns of praise let us, the faithful, exalt the Mother of God,* the solid foundation of our faith* and the precious gift to our souls:* Rejoice, O woman who contained in your womb the Rock of life!* Rejoice, O hope of the world and helper of those who are in trouble!* Rejoice, O bride and Virgin forever!
theotokion.tone_8.generic.usage: Monday Vespers and Tuesday Matins after God the Lord...

theotokion.tone_8.generic_alt.content: O pure Virgin, in your motherly tenderness... (see above).
theotokion.tone_8.generic_alt.usage: Thursday at the end of Matins

theotokion.tone_8.tue_thu_vespers.content: When the Mother beheld upon the cross* the Lamb, the Shepherd, and the Savior of the world,* she exclaimed tearfully:* The world rejoices at the sight of its redemption,* but my heart is afire as I see your pain on the cross,* which You accept for the sake of all, O my Son and my God!
theotokion.tone_8.tue_thu_vespers.usage: Tuesday and Thursday Vespers; Wednesday and Friday Matins after God the Lord...

theotokion.tone_8.wed_fri_matins_end.content: O pure One, the fruit of your womb* is the perfect fulfillment of the prophets and of the Law.* Therefore, O Mother of God, we glorify you with thanks,* and we exalt you with great devotion.
theotokion.tone_8.wed_fri_matins_end.usage: Wednesday and Friday at the end of Matins

theotokion.tone_8.fri_vespers.usage: Friday Vespers and Saturday Matins after God the Lord...

theotokion.tone_8.sat_matins_end.content:
O pure Virgin, in your motherly tenderness... (see above).

O Lady receive the prayers of your servants, and deliver us from all sorrow and tribulation.
theotokion.tone_8.sat_matins_end.usage: Saturday at the end of Matins
